title: Intro to R for Social Science
description: Learn the basics of R programming for social science research.

title: Data Ethics and Privacy
description: Understand ethical issues in data handling.

title: Python for Data Analysis
description: Hands-on workshop on using Python for analyzing research data.

title: Getting Started with OneNote
description: Learn to organize your academic notes effectively using OneNote.

title: Reference Management Tools: Zotero & Mendeley
description: Overview of popular tools for managing and citing research references.

title: Academic Writing for Researchers
description: Develop your academic writing skills with practical tips and exercises.

title: Designing Effective Conference Posters
description: Learn best practices for creating eye-catching and informative posters.

title: Presentation Skills for Researchers
description: Tips and techniques for delivering impactful research presentations.
place: Training Room B, Lancaster Environment Centre

title: Time Management for Grad Students
description: Strategies to manage your time efficiently during your research journey.

title: AI Tools for Academic Research
description: Explore how AI tools can enhance your literature review, writing, and analysis.

title: Policy Engagement for Researchers
description: Learn how to communicate your research effectively to policymakers and influence policy.

title: Conducting a Literature Review
description: Learn systematic approaches to conducting a thorough and organized literature review.

title: Environmental Modelling with GIS
description: Hands-on training in using Geographic Information Systems (GIS) to analyze and model environmental data. Learn practical techniques for mapping, spatial analysis, and scenario simulation.
